title: Fergus Tiernan
text:
Fergus Tiernan (born 3 January 1982) is a former <a href="association%20football">football</a> <a href="midfielder">midfielder</a> who retired from the sport in 2009 at the age of 27.
Football career.
Raised in <a href="Helensburgh">Helensburgh</a>, Tiernan began his career at <a href="Scottish%20Premier%20League">Scottish Premier League</a> club <a href="Aberdeen%20F.C.">Aberdeen</a>, and also had spells at <a href="Ross%20County%20F.C.">Ross County</a> and <a href="Dumbarton%20F.C.">Dumbarton</a> before his initial decision to retire in January 2009. He made a brief comeback with <a href="Queen%27s%20Park%20F.C.">Queen's Park</a> later in 2009 before changing his mind once again.
Career after football.
Having become a <a href="firefighter">firefighter</a> after dropping out of full-time football, Tiernan found it difficult to accommodate his football and work commitments. He retired from professional football at the age of 27 in 2009.
